text: Margaret Munnerlyn Mitchell (November 8, 1900 â€“ August 16, 1949) was an American novelist. She is best known for writing Gone with the Wind. She was born in Atlanta, Georgia. Her mother's family was Irish Roman Catholic. In Atlanta on 11 August 1949, Mitchell was hit by a car driven by a drunk driver. Five days later, she died of her injuries. The driver was convicted of involuntary manslaughter. == References == Category:1900 births Category:1949 deaths Category:American manslaughter victims Category:American novelists Category:Road accident deaths in the United States Category:Writers from Atlanta
title: Margaret Mitchell
